Unable to sign in! We aren't sure what happened.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Login and Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting problems with PiecesOS, including failures to launch, difficulties connecting to cloud services, and sign-in errors. Proposed solutions involve checking network configurations, examining log files for troubleshooting, and contacting Pieces support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 is experiencing issues with PiecesOS, including:
    * Difficulty making requests to cloud services
    * Problems with local models

**Problems identified:**

* Mark-at-Pieces suspects firewall or network configuration issues might be blocking PiecesOS' outgoing requests.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-Pieces requests Rohanrathi99 to provide logs for com.pieces.os && com.pieces.pfd.
* Rohanrathi99 provides the requested log files via Google Drive.
* Mark-at-Pieces requests access to the log files and provides their email address.
* Rohanrathi99 grants access.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Mark-at-Pieces has received the log files and will likely analyze them to diagnose the issue further.
* The conversation is ongoing until a resolution is found.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation also includes links to related GitHub issues and helpful resources.
* Mark-at-Pieces offers real-time debugging via their calendar.

**Overall, this conversation demonstrates the support process for troubleshooting issues with PiecesOS. The issue has not yet been resolved, but steps have been taken towards identifying and fixing the problem.**

PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* MR-AAYU is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces Desktop application.

**Problems Identified:**

* The exact nature of the boot issue is unclear.
* Possible causes include:
    * Issues with core dependencies.
    * Missing log files.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* pieces-support-bot recommends checking similar issues and resources.
* mark-at-pieces requests log files for analysis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation is ongoing.
* The issue is not yet resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces support team.
* MR-AAYU is expected to receive a follow-up within 24 hours.
* The issue appears to be related to booting the Desktop application.

I hope this summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any other questions.

related_issues.title: Unable to sign in! We aren't sure what happened.
related_issues.text:
Unable to sign in! We aren't sure what happened.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Updated

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i install Pieces for vs code and its not connecting to my google account and github account , i install extension in vs code when i try to connect their github it this error is showing "Unable to sign in! We aren't sure what happened. If the issue persists, please contact support. in Windows"
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User Usama-integriti is experiencing difficulties signing in to the Pieces app.
* The issue has been identified by the Pieces support bot and assigned to mark-at-pieces.

**Problems identified:**

* User is unable to sign in to the Pieces app.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Clearing the browser cache.
* Scheduling a time to meet with a Pieces support member.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User is advised to try clearing the browser cache.
* If the problem persists, they are recommended to schedule a meeting with mark-at-pieces.

**Additional notes:**

* The user may find similar issues and resources listed in the support bot's initial comment helpful.

**Overall, the conversation is ongoing and a solution has not yet been reached.**

recommendations: **Investigate and address PiecesOS login and connectivity issues:** This appears to be the most common problem reported by users. Prioritize finding the root cause and providing a solution.

**Improve error messaging:** Vague messages like "Unable to sign in! We aren't sure what happened." are not helpful for users. Provide more specific information about the error and potential solutions.
**Develop troubleshooting documentation:** Create comprehensive guides for common issues, including network configuration, log file analysis, and contacting support.
**Consider firewall and network configurations:** As suggested by a support agent, these factors might contribute to connectivity problems. Provide guidance or automated checks to address them.
**Enhance communication about ongoing issues:** Keep users informed about the progress of investigations and expected resolution times for known problems like the cloud service issues.
